wikipedia_page.main: Lewis Terence Hardman (born 25 March 1989) is an English former professional footballer who played in the Football League for Darlington. A midfielder or right back, he also played non-league football for clubs including Whitby Town, Shildon, Sunderland Nissan and Bishop Auckland.

response: A young Boro side cruised to a comfortable victory over Darlington in the next friendly. Adam Johnson opened the scoring by converting a penalty, with Marvin Emnes scoring his first goal for the club to leave the visitors two-up at the break. A Lewis Hardman own goal and a goal from Tony McMahon put Boro further in front, before Johnson scored his second of the game to complete a comfortable 5–0 victory.
